page.title: 02Description of ref. 03680071
page.content: This area contains the settlement known as Weston which is made up of several different residential zones. The most modern residential area is known as Courtlands, or the Navy estate, and this houses many families connected with the Navy. There is a council estate known as Pound Piece and an area of older terraced houses known as Channel View. The area has two buildings of interest one very old and the other very new. The old building is St.George's church built in the style of Christopher Wren using local stone. The church is no longer used for worship but it is open to the public and some recent restoration has taken place. The new building is the Royal Manor Comprehensive School completed on the site of the old secondary school and officially opened in 1986.
